decks.notes: The deck focuses on aggressively filling the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting, Goblin Lore, and Burning Inquiry to cheat out powerful threats like Hollow One, Flamewake Phoenix, and Bloodghast quickly. The deck also utilizes delve creatures like Gurmag Angler and Tasigur, the Golden Fang to put pressure on the opponent while disrupting their strategy with cards like Lingering Souls and Lightning Bolt. The mana base is designed to efficiently cast the spells and creatures and maintain consistency throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with cards like Life from the Loam, Faithless Looting, and Shriekhorn, in order to trigger the Dredge mechanic and bring back creatures like Bloodghast, Prized Amalgam, and Narcomoeba from the graveyard to the battlefield. The goal is to create a powerful board presence through repeated graveyard recursion and use cards like Conflagrate and Scourge Devil to close out the game quickly. The deck leverages the synergy between dredge cards and graveyard recursion to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless combo assault.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively deal direct damage to the opponent using burn spells and efficient creatures. By combining creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Goblin Guide, and Grim Lavamancer with powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Boros Charm, and Lava Spike, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. The inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Searing Blaze helps to control the board and punish opponents for casting spells, ultimately allowing the deck to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to out-value the opponent while also maintaining board presence with creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Vendilion Clique. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, control the board state, and ultimately win the game through incremental advantage and superior card advantage. The inclusion of cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Cryptic Command gives the deck additional ways to control the game and protect its own threats.

The key strategy of this deck is to assemble the Krark-Clan Ironworks combo to generate infinite mana and card draw, utilizing Scrap Trawler and Myr Retriever to loop artifacts and trigger additional effects. The deck includes various ways to tutor for key pieces, alongside mana acceleration and card draw, to quickly set up the combo. Aetherflux Reservoir serves as a win condition by using the generated mana to deal lethal damage to the opponent. The deck aims to efficiently assemble the combo pieces and control the game until it can win in a single explosive turn.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard through discard spells and cycling cards to power out large threats like Hollow One, Gurmag Angler, and Flamewake Phoenix. By aggressively attacking with these creatures and utilizing recursion with Bloodghast, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly before they can stabilize. The inclusion of disruptive spells like Collective Brutality and Tasigur, the Golden Fang help to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining pressure on the board. Additionally, the deck utilizes Blood Moon to disrupt opponents who rely on non-basic lands.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of small artifacts that can quickly become large threats with the help of cards like Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer. The deck aims to take advantage of the synergy between artifacts, combining aggressive creatures like Vault Skirge and Signal Pest with powerful finishers like Arcbound Ravager and Master of Etherium. By utilizing cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to accelerate mana production, this deck can quickly put pressure on the opponent and close out games before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on assembling Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine to generate enough mana to cast powerful, game-ending threats such as Wurmcoil Engine, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck utilizes control elements like Karn Liberated and Oblivion Stone to remove threats from the opponent's side of the board, while also having access to cards like Sylvan Scrying and Ancient Stirrings to find the necessary Tron lands. Additionally, the deck includes a variety of color-fixing artifacts to ensure smooth mana development.

This deck focuses on utilizing a toolbox of creatures to combo off and generate value. By using cards like Eldritch Evolution and Felidar Guardian along with Saheeli Rai, the deck can create infinite copies of creatures or generate powerful synergies. Cards like Voice of Resurgence and Eternal Witness provide value and recursion, while mana ramp creatures like Noble Hierarch and Lotus Cobra help accelerate the deck's game plan. Additionally, the deck includes utility creatures like Acidic Slime for disruption. The key strategy is to assemble the combo pieces while controlling the board with removal spells like Path to Exile.

This Modern 1 vs 1 deck heavily relies on graveyard manipulation and recursion to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a continuous stream of creatures. By using cards like Cathartic Reunion and Faithless Looting to fill the graveyard with creatures like Stinkweed Imp and Bloodghast, as well as spells like Life from the Loam to bring back lands and trigger effects like Prized Amalgam and Narcomoeba, this deck aims to create a powerful board presence and win the game through a combination of fast aggression and consistent value generation.

The main concept of this deck is to use the powerful lands of UrzaTron (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to quickly ramp up to high mana to cast big threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, World Breaker, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck also utilizes control elements like Karn Liberated, Oblivion Stone, and Ghost Quarter to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect itself. Expedition Map and Sylvan Scrying help to quickly assemble the Tron lands, while Ancient Stirrings digs for key cards. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's mana base and hand while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It aims to slow down the opponent's game plan by taxing their spells with Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Leonin Arbiter, while also utilizing flicker effects to keep their board in check. Restoration Angel and Eldrazi Displacer provide value by blinking creatures and disrupting the opponent's strategies. With a mix of disruption and aggression, this deck aims to control the game and secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on swarming the board with aggressive Human creatures, maximizing their abilities to disrupt and overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls to cheat creatures into play and protect them from counter spells, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and quickly close out games. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Meddling Mage further disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Phantasmal Image and Reflector Mage provide flexibility and additional utility. The goal is to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent with a relentless onslaught of efficient threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing mana ramp creatures like Elvish Mystic and Birds of Paradise to quickly power out threats like Knight of the Reliquary and Courser of Kruphix. It also includes powerful land synergies with cards like Ramunap Excavator and Tectonic Edge to control the opponent's resources. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disruptive land interactions, while also providing card advantage through cards like Collected Company and Tireless Tracker. Ultimately, the deck's strategy is to maintain pressure and board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck revolves around creating infinite loops with Krark-Clan Ironworks and various artifacts, allowing the player to generate unlimited mana and draw their entire deck. The key strategy is to sacrifice artifacts like Terrarion and Ichor Wellspring to the Ironworks, recurring them with Scrap Trawler and Myr Retriever to continue the combo. With the help of cards like Mox Opal and Ancient Stirrings, the player can assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently. The deck aims to win by either decking out the opponent or dealing lethal damage with Walking Ballista.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and disrupting the opponent's mana base with land destruction spells like Stone Rain and Blood Moon. It utilizes powerful creatures like Tireless Tracker, Stormbreath Dragon, and Inferno Titan to control the board and finish the game. The combination of mana acceleration with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf allows for playing big threats ahead of schedule. Additionally, the inclusion of Chandra planeswalkers provides additional removal and card advantage to keep the opponent on the back foot.
